s.text: However, tumors from Wnt-1 TG, Pten +/+ mice have low apoptotic rates (40 ± 16 per digital camera field using a 20x objective) and high proliferation rates (53% ± 11).
4), suggesting that Pten was, indeed, made from the second allele.

One such candidate is the rapamycin analog CCI779, which has been suggested to inhibit the AKT signaling pathway, probably through inhibition of mTOR (target of rapamycin), a potential target of AKT [reviewed in ref.

The majority of tumors in Wnt-1 TG, Pten +/- mice had lost the wild type allele of Pten , suggesting that the complete inactivation of Pten function provides an additional growth advantage to these tumors.
